definition: to burn/to burn down
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The carcass of a burned-out building.
sentences.chinese: 烧毁建筑物的基本构架。

sentences.english: Li Zhongming would burn up those drawings, he left home leave Yang Nian letters.
sentences.chinese: 黎仲明将那些图纸烧毁，他临走时给杨念留下书信。

sentences.english: Militants burn NATO fuel tankers in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦民兵烧毁北约运油车。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 许多建筑被闪电击中烧毁于地，另一些被军阀烧毁。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 许多建筑被闪电击中烧毁于地，另一些被军阀烧毁。

sentences.english: The huge factory was gutted in minutes.
sentences.chinese: 那座大工厂的内部于几分钟内全部烧毁。

sentences.english: They threatened to burn down our house.
sentences.chinese: 他们威胁要烧毁我们的房子。

sentences.english: The motor of frequently reversible discharging equipment is very easy to be burnt out.
sentences.chinese: 频繁可逆运转卸料设备，其电动机极易烧毁。

sentences.english: That would incinerate the heart of a major city.
sentences.chinese: 它能够烧毁一座大型城市的中心地带。

sentences.english: This machine is designed to burn up if overused.
sentences.chinese: 那个机器，按其设念，如果过度使用就会烧毁。

sentences.english: What induced these people to burn houses and to murder their fellow-creatures?
sentences.chinese: 是什么迫使这些人烧毁房屋和杀害自己的同类呢？

sentences.english: I should return to Verus and show him the charred transcript.
sentences.chinese: 我应该返回维洛司处，将烧毁的抄本交给他。

sentences.english: The Churchill bushfire burnt out more than 30, 000 hectares of land.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔山火烧毁了超过3万公顷的土地。

sentences.english: It was built using oak and the exterior is clad in burnt larch wood.
sentences.chinese: 这是采用橡木和外部是穿着烧毁落叶松木材。

sentences.english: The fire has destoryed hundreds of homes and forced thousands of people to evacuate.
sentences.chinese: 大火烧毁了数百座住房，数千人被迫转移。

sentences.english: The spacecraft burned up when it re-entered the earth's atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙飞船重新进入地球大气层时烧毁了。

definition: to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
to damage/to devastate/to vandalize/damage/destruction
to set on fire/to commit arson
to burn/to set on fire
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to catch fire/on fire/fire (alarm)
to destroy/to smash
to burn to death
to eradicate/to extinguish
to steal everything
to damage/to injure
to dismantle/to demolish
to set on fire/to commit arson/to create a disturbance
to level/to raze to the ground
